reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Finnpartnership: Commercialization of Somali and Kenyan gums and resins and other essential oil raw materials

description.narrative: Finn Church Aid (FCA) is specialized in operations on three themes peace work education and livelihoods. In addition FCA is committed to the UN's objectives for sustainable development. The project combines in a unique way all the FCA's themes and covers 1 2 of the UN 17 sustainable goals by bringing together training and employment of the risk and vulnerable groups and production chain of renewable raw materials in accordance with sustainable development. Project seeks to address the risks of violence confl icts violent extremism and perpetuated marginalization by focusing on the support the existing informal economic networks to benefit the mainstream business operatives and linkages to markets. The project targets youth and women in three Counties in Kenya (Wajir Isiolo and Mandera) and Somalia (Baari Sool Sanag and Central Region) for connectivity with the opportunities for value chain development. The potentials for this approach are enormous. For instance a baseline study conducted by ADESO in Wajir in Au gust 2016 has shown that Kenya has the potential to produce 4000MT of gums and resins of which more than half i.e. 2200 is from Wajir alone. Creating the opportunities for value chains in the extraction quality management and marketing of gum and raisins p rovides immediate source of incomes and a new local economic system that will maximizes youth potentials in a productive manner.
